title: Efficient service.
body: I needed to renew my prescription after leaving hospital. I was told to do this by contacting my GP. This was something I hadn't needed to do for a while. I was dreading it to be honest. However, it couldn't have been easier. I did it over the phone in 5 minutes. This was such a relief.

title: Good Practice
body: They were accomodating and approachable. The thing I don't like is hard and it takes a long hour before you can talk to them for appointment or some other reasons.

title: Lots of support
body: Lots of support given, willingness to listen, considering different options, all bases covered and thoroughly explored.

title: Great practise
body: Had a double appt. Late getting in but the doctor was brilliant very thorough and explained everything to me. Thank you

title: Wonderful treatment.
body:
I just wanted to thank all the doctors nurses and staff on the day care cardiology department. 
So attentive, patient, caring. Thank you.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly and helpful staff
body:
I just wanted to say thank you for your prompt and friendly response
I helped my daughter with a e- consultation
After only about an hour a very lovely doctor rang, discussed her issue and then arranged to send a prescription
Really wonderful service

title: Excellent Service
body:
I attended the Endoscopy Ward at the Infirmary for a colonoscopy procedure. 
Everyone was extremely friendly, welcoming, and efficient.
The actual procedure was carried out with the minimum of fuss and everything was fully explained to me.
I felt entirely comfortable throughout.

All in all a great advert for the National Health Service

Many thanks

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Fantastic Service
body: I'm on holiday in Cockermouth and needed antibiotics for an infection. On first contacting the surgery, the receptionist was very helpful and patient as I couldn't remember the address of the cottage where I was staying. I was sent a link to upload photos, was contacted by a doctor and a visit was arranged with antibiotics prescribed. The chemist who made up my prescription was very pleasant and wished me a good holiday. Given the previous reviews on the website I was initially concerned about contacting the surgery but all I can say is thank you to you all, you are doing a fantastic job under difficult circumstances.

title: Great care
body: I would like to thank all the staff on children's HDU for making my baby granddaughter better she was so poorly I was frightened to death but you made her better and now she is home thank you üòä ‚ù§ ‚ô• üíï

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: The doctors are polite and helpful in a professional manner and the staff are very helpful and friendly and professional too

title: Fantastic care
body: After spending time in hospital i was discharged on a Saturday afternoon,my Doctor phoned me at home on  Sunday morning  with my new prescription details and words of total reassurance,he also gave me follow up appointments to the surgery,. I can not fault in any way at all this excellent service, I can not thank them enough for the care I received now or in the past and I've been with this practice since it opened,

title: Great service
body: From referral to appointment was quick and efficient. Parking was very easy and appointment on time. Consultation was very professional.

title: Seen at last after three months wait.
body: Thought better give an up/date to my complaints listed on here.After last complaint letter handed in personally finally got a reply saying my concerns will be looked into. No rush mind you it took them three weeks to do just that. Then they write saying no record of me making any calls or anything, Hence i went in there on 14/2 2022 and spoke with the practice office staff. To staff sitting there one said we do not have a number to call you back on as here it states ex directionary well you phoned me about a Flue jab, Told would look into it and by the time i got home was phoned to go back and be seen this afternoon by a nurse of course. Yes as i knew have an ear infection been prescribed for it but what a poor service? It amazes me people who do not seem to know what ex directionary means have a job like this in particular where all their contact is done by phone now. Good job my untreated infection has not led to Sepsis but it will happen to someone before they get their act together,

title: Impossible to get trough by telephone
body: I am very disappointed with the telephone service. I was trying on and on to get to talk to the appointment service in order to book my screening.I keep receiving letters from them, but it is impossible to get hold to this service. The phone just gives you a message saying that is unable to connect you this time. Every time...

title: Comforting  atmosphere
body: Very helpful and reassuring, l came home feeling better for talking over about my complaint, having been given  the time to do so.

title: Awful
body:
Yet again another load of mistakes by this terrible practice, this is the third time in as many weeks, given an appointment to see a doctor, replaced by a call from a nurse, given a prescription which is cancelled when I go to collect it from the pharmacy, the pharmacist told me it‚Äôs either cancelled or the prescriber is not authorised to prescribe it, ring up and it‚Äôs not cancelled so make your own mind up. 
So I now sit hear in excruciating pain waiting for them to decide what to do next, is it any wonder people turn up at A&E when your GP offers a service like this

title: Absolutely brilliant ward 20 and cardiology
body:
From the moment I visited ward 20 to the all people, who dealt with me in the cardiology unit, a massive thank you to you all, everyone was so professional and caring, the reassurance and friendliness from everyone I encountered made me feel, very humble and lucky to be among such special people, who work in such pressurised environments and always remain calm and somehow manage to keep there sense of humours, no matter the situation, you are very special individual people and as a team are incredibly professional. 
Massive Thank you.

title: Cannot get through on phone today
body:
I was left a voicemail this morning by the Health Centre asking me to return their call.  I have been ringing 01225 866611 ever since, stopping after each 50-55 minutes so BT don't charge for the call.  And it's not as though I want to contact them!
There now seems to be a telephone queuing system (where you spend 40 minutes or more) before you can get onto the normal practice queuing system. 
I assume something is very wrong here.

title: Perfect Care
body: Even in the stress and pressures of the last few years, PMG have always been able to ensure my many reviews were carried out to time.  They have been attentive enough to see when changes to medication and treatment were needed. Clear explanations have always been provided.  A patient with them for over 30 years and standards have always been high. I write from my personal experience and I feel my review would be endorsed across the village.

title: Absolutely Terrible Telephone Appointment
body:
I was referred to St Bart's Hospital by a Consultant at a different hospital way back in May 2021. I didn't really want to be referred, as I was scared that I would have to have a telephone appointment instead of a face-to-face appointment. My worst fears came true when I was told I would have to have a telephone, as the doctors were not doing face-to-face appointments. I reluctantly accepted the telephone appointment, as I felt I had no choice in the matter. Looking back now, I wish I hadn't agreed to have a telephone appointment as it was absolutely awful. The appointment was rushed and it felt more like an interrogation than an outpatient clinic appointment. Even the doctor said I should have been able to have a face-to-face appointment, as they could tell I was struggling and anxious during the telephone appointment. The doctor told me they would have been happy to see me face-to-face, but management wouldn't allow it to happen.

The appointment only lasted just over 15 minutes which isn't long enough for a first appointment, especially when it had to take place over the telephone where communication between the patient and doctor is much harder. I am now worried that there may have been some miscommunication between myself and the doctor, as I was getting a bit confused at times trying to explain everything over the telephone. 

As you can gather I really don't like telephone appointments. This was my very first ever appointment under the care of a doctor at Barts Hospital and it didn't give me a very good first impression of the hospital. I am supposed to be getting another appointment for 6 months' time and I really hope and pray it will be a face-to-face appointment, as the thought of having to have another telephone appointment feels me with dreed.

title: very disappointing
body: Very disappointing! I had an appointment with children at 3:30 and I waited until 4:30 after I called  health  visitor and she told me that it would arrive in 10 minutes .. and then she told me that I actually had an appointment another day at 3: 30 .. leave it to be desired !!

title: Very disappointed
body: I had a colposcopy on 15.1.2022. The doctor or nurse I actually don't know because she didn't introduce herself wasn't in good mood. The way she approached me make me feel uncomfortable. I find it rude and there was definitely no emphaty. They were running late. I can understand the pressure but she should keep professional manners. Colposcopy was very painful. I don't know if it is painful normally or not so I am not gonna blame on her. But what very disappointed me is that she took very bad sample. Laboratory could get any result of it. So all this struggling was for nothing and I will have to repeat it. I was waiting for this appointment for half year. I was happy to finally find out what is going on with my health but unfortunately I fell into wrong hands.

title: Long wait times and no seats
body: Had to stand up for 2 hours queuing to then be told I had to wait for another 6 hours

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appalling practice
body:
Wrong immunisations on my notes -twice
6 weeks to get an x-ray which showed a fractured vertebrae
three weeks to get medication prescribed requested by specialist service
wrong blood test results sent to my husband
two incidences of being given wrong clinical advice by non medical receptionist
very poor communication
Unhelpful staff at times 
Highly inadequate appointment system
Assurance GP would call today for ongoing acute problem now evening no call 
26 attempts today to get through on phone finally did 45 min after surgery opened no appointments with anyone

title: Fantastic surgery
body:
I have been registered at glebelands for the past 10 years. I have always had a good experience along with my family. 
The doctors, nurses and staff are always so helpful and kind. I have always felt listened to and respected. They are efficient and reliable. Cannot fault them really. 
I do not usually recommend this surgery as I am too selfish and don‚Äôt want them to become overwhelmed with patients! 
Overall, brilliant surgery.

title: Phone appointment
body:
This was booked for 2pm today,I've heard nothing or not had a missed call.
This appointment took me 2 weeks to obtain for a prescription review.
Do I now wait or try yet again to try to obtain another appointment?

title: PAU is very POOR
body: Waited 3 hours for a 2 min dose of medicine. No doctors visited us. Or examined. 1 nurse simply going off instructions. No communication. No nothing. I am beginning to think there are no drs in PAU

title: A&E dreadful service rude staff and a chaotic‚Ä¶
body: My daughter attended A&E on 14th February 2022. She spent 6 hours being moved from pillar to post. When she asked what was happening staff said AMU weren‚Äôt answering their phone so she was left for 5 hours. When I complained a Dr walked down to AMU and spoke to the sister in charge who said he/she would look at her case after shift change over (7:30PM) at 9:45 PM she was told she was 10th in the waiting list which was probably another 10 hour wait. Total waiting time 18 hours. This is shocking. When she left the sister in charge said ‚Äúthis would go down as a self discharge‚Äù All he wanted to do was tick the box. He also said ‚Äúif she presented again she would have to go through the same process. The system is broken and no amount of money will put it right.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Passionate Care
body: I felt in safe hands from my first step into the hospital. From pre-assessment to admission, though to pre and post surgery care including physiotherapy, the experience was so professional, regimented yet delivered with a passion and reassuringly friendly. My fear of surgery, this having been my first, has been totally washed away and all because of the tremendous staff effort at the BMI hospital

title: Outstanding practice
body: Myself & my daughter have been patients of this practice for over 10 years and I have received the greatest support throughout this entire time. Not only from the GPs, but also from the reception staff. I have always been able to see a Dr on the same day in an emergency, and he is always patient & thorough. On the occasions when I have forgotten to put in a repeat prescription with sufficient time, the reception staff have chased this up for me so that my daughter has not been left without medication. Although things were adapted during COVID, the level of support did not change. Thank you. I am so very grateful.

title: Could work on their approach
body: I was advised by 111 to go to a&e due to a mental health crisis I was having, I was having thoughts of harming myself. I was seen pretty quickly which was good but I seen two ladies who took me to a private room to talk a little more about what I‚Äôm going through, they both stood in front of the double doors with notepads, it was as if it was being guarded which obviously it wasn‚Äôt but when it comes to such senstitive topics I believe they could of sat down and made me feel at ease so I could open up further. I felt like I had done something wrong and it has made me think twice about reaching out when I need help in future.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank You
body: Every member of staff greet you presently, even on a phone call. They are patient, understanding and caring.  My husband and I have been with practice since 2011, we have always received a very good service. We take this opportunity to thank every single member of the practice for their unfailing service and dedication to my husband and I üòÄ

author: WLpww67
title: My 78 year old mother was sent home at night with no door key
body:
Its 4am in the morning and I've just had to retrieve my 78 year old mum from outside her house in the rain due to incompetence.  
She was admitted by ambulance due to severe abdominal pain requiring iv morphine to get her to the Western. She arrived at approximately 7pm and by 1am they had decided she was going home. She tried to call me however was unable to reach me so the hospital arranged a taxi and dropped her off at her house where she had no house key.  
I am absolutely fuming that:  
1. She was discharged so quickly following IV morphine with her pain level rated a 10 on discharge, no different to when she phoned the ambulance  
2. Elderly patient who lives alone thrown out of a hospital unwell without knowing there was anyone to care for her  
3. Discharged without any pain relief.  
This is absolutely unacceptable. I appreciate bed spaces are short but she asked to stay overnight and was told no. I foresee us having to now phone another ambulance for readmission if circumstances don't improve. I really don't believe they got to the bottom of the cause of the pain.

readBy.name: Office of Foysol Choudhury, MSP for North Edinburgh, Leith, Edinburgh Western & West Lothian

author: betajq75
title: It isn't safe to ask for help and I would like a kinder quieter place to go to
body:
My sister has helped me write this. She is in a carer's support group in Islington.  
I feel too frightened to ask for help when I need help. The crisis line have no patience. I think this is because I also have a learning disability. I need them to speak slowly and quietly.  
The hospital at Highgate is very noisy and the nurses just shout at you. No one is kind except for the cleaners. It is like the prisons you see on the TV except we have no phones and can't contact people. I get very lonely.  
I got sectioned and they stopped my visitors because of covid. I had no one to help me. My sister wasn't allowed in. My advocate wasn't either. No nurses ever spoke to me.  
I had my period and needed pads and they didn't have any and it was a woman's ward. Then they said I could only have 2 pads to last a day and a night. It was horrible and I felt unclean. The bathroom doesn't have doors.  
I want to be able to go to a night time cafe so I can be with kind people if my mental health is bad.  
I don't want nurses to be there. Just other people who are feeling the same way as me. That would be better.  
I wouldn't be frightened then and I would get better. The hospital is a horrible place.

readBy.name: Camden and Islington NHS Foundation Trust

author: tfb67
title: Excellent CBT sessions help me with anxiety and panic attacks
body:
I had excellent 6 sessions at Talk Wandsworth. Practitioner Melisa was willing to back up all theories with examples and encouraged me to think. She has great skills of engagement and a huge knowledge base.  
I feel I have gained numerous useful tools to use on a daily basis in order to control my anxiety and panic attacks. After my last session today I feel I'm able to see and apply clear advantages of CBT practically in my everyday life and therefore control my anxiety and stress especially relating to my working place.

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

author: statusry87
title: Delays in managing peanut allergy in 1 year old
body:
My baby suffered a severe allergic reaction to peanut butter (3rd exposure). We rang NHS 111 who had a 30min hold time, so I hung up and dialled 999 as he developed facial swelling.  
I was advised earliest an ambulance could reach us was 3 hours but average was 9 hours so could we drive him to a&e. This feels absolutely outrageous for a child under 2 who could have gone on to develop breathing problems to be left for approx 9 hrs. Fortunately we had a car.  
Seen immediately in a&e which was great. Outcome was referral to dietician and allergy clinic.  
Dietician review: I was really shocked at the lack of patient-centred care demonstrated during my consultation with paediatric dietician. Poor listening skills, and I felt pretty much ‚Äúthrown out‚Äù of the online appointment.  
Time was wasted telling me things when I had specific questions that remain unanswered. Also no open questions were used and I realised at the end that the dietician was still unaware of the further allergies we have identified since. It ended with ‚ÄúI need to go, I have other patients‚Äù. Felt really upset that I had not been listened to and questions remain unanswered.  
Allergy clinic: incident occurred in Sept 2021. Referral to clinic did not happen until Dec 2021. Why did it take so long? This clinic has a long waiting list and this delay adds on nearly three months to an already anxious wait.  
As an NHS worker myself I 100% understand service pressures. However all of this feels just unacceptable to me. Ambulance wait, poor communication skills and why would it take so long to put in a simple referral for something as serious as peanut allergy in a baby?

author: Jaques27Gilles
title: Security staff lacked compassion or politeness
body:
I want to give feedback on my wife‚Äôs visit to the Emergency Department at Truro one evening last week.  
The care and attention of the nursing staff and doctors could not have been better and for that we are very grateful. The same could not be said of the security guards (that‚Äôs the only way to describe them), at the ED.  
We had waited in the waiting area for about an hour when three guards arrived and without any given reason they told everyone who wasn‚Äôt a patient to leave. Their attitude was as if they were policing at a nightclub or rock concert, not people who were vulnerable, in an alien environment and some who couldn‚Äôt stand, let alone walk without assistance.  
One elderly lady who couldn‚Äôt stand without assistance was shouted at by one of the guards because he could not understand what she was saying.  
Their attitude was completely without compassion or politeness. When challenged they just said it was because of Covid crowding and the ‚Äúrules‚Äù. Well nothing changed between one minute and the next, so why were we thrown out, because that‚Äôs what it felt like. Even later on when my wife was discharged at 22:00 they were still not allowing carers to enter, even through there were only half a dozen people in there.  
I am 72 and my wife is 71. She was left on her own with a twisted knee, head injury, bruised wrist and sore neck in a hospital she didn‚Äôt know, without anyone to comfort her.  
The guards very obviously had no training in caring for elderly and confused patients. I was told to wait outside in a temperature of 4 degrees without proper clothing. We were part of a coach tour and had arrived at the hospital by taxi and so did not have a car to wait in. It was only after two hours that someone waiting with me told me that there was a main reception area a few minutes‚Äô walk away. How much better it would have been to have been told this earlier.  
I will always obey instructions if they are sensible, reasonable and given in a civilised way. These guards were anything but this. Your policy on how patients and carers are approached in the waiting area needs a serious review.

author: Man of Steel
title: Informative pre-assessment clinic made me confident
body:
I visited the pre-assessment clinic prior to having a total knee replacement and found it very useful and informative.  
The staff were professional and answered all my questions with a light touch which put me entirely at ease and I left feeling confident that I was in capable hands.

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care for appendicitis
body:
After being referred by my GP with a suspected bladder infection, due to severe pain I had, I arrived into 4 south then discovered it was appendicitis.  
Initially a scan was arranged to rule out appendicitis, as this didn't take place it delayed my diagnosis. My symptoms are past the stage of an operation so antibiotics are all they can do for me at the moment. In hindsight, I wish they had done the scan as it could have sped up the process and alleviated the pain quicker.  
However, I am feeling more comfortable now and the nurses and doctors are great which helps. In terms of the food, I am a picky eater at the best of times, so I haven't really been eating much as it hasn't been to my liking.  
Thankfully I have been able to have my mum for visiting, so that has made things a lot easier and I feel less lonely.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Friendly and Efficient
body: Staff are very friendly and helpful. Easy to get appointments with minimal wait times. Overall, a very professional and efficient service.

title: Excellent care provided
body: I had knee arthroscopy at Canterbury Day Surgery. I received excellent care from all the staff members throughout my admission, preparation for my operation, surgery, and aftercare. Thank you for making my first ever operation under general anaesthetic so stress- free.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: great stuff
body:
helpful and responsive, respectfull ,kind and very patient.
they helped me a lot an dlooked well after me and my family

title: Caring staff
body:
Ive just spent almost 4 weeks on the High Dependency Unit and Sitwell Ward. I cannot thank the staff enough for their high standards and quality of care. I spent at least 2 weeks in considerable pain, staff not only treated my pain but also my emotional distress. I needed help with all aspcts of my personal care and this was completed with dignity and respect.
There were times when the staff worked under incredible pressure with more patients than beds or shotage of staff,  this didnt compromise the care i was given.
Every day i saw members from different teams, medical, physio, dieticians, etc who kept me informed and encouraged me to get better.
At one point i had a slight issue but raised it with the ward manager where it was immediately resolved without repercussion.
While hoping i dont have to return to hospital i would have no hesitation in returning to Sitwell Ward.
A big thankyou to all.

title: Very compassionate
body: I was extremely anxious and had previously had a bad then experience with a different trust concerning my referral, however the Matron, receptionist & all the lovey nurses made sure I received the best treatment. They treated me with such compassion, care and were so friendly. I had to wait for patient transport at times abd was made comfortable & given a cup of tea with no bother at all. They are amazing on there, gyne 2 is a credit to the trust.

title: Never get an appointment
body: Try to get my 3 year old an appointment because he has been moaning that's he body hurting  and getting marks over him and told after trying  to get through to them on the phone had to ring over 200 times from 8 am and at 8.45 am got to speek to them at told to call back tomorrow.

title: Poor practice
body: Received a text message to make an appointment advised to ring between 0800 & 0830. When you ring and phone never gets answered not acceptable

title: Very professionale
body: Staff are exstreamly professionale and friendly facilities were spotless and the service excellent  would highly recommend

title: Nothing but praise
body: I was sent to the Women's Centre for Health for a hysterectomy for endometrial cancer from Torbay Hospital. It was a very frightening time for me, made so much easier by the speed I was dealt with and the kindness and professionalism undertaken by the medical team and nursing staff. I was handled with dignity and felt informed and in the very best of hands. We were particularly impressed by the surgeon ringing my husband to reassure him and let  him know how the operation had gone - the human touch goes a long way. In spite of being short staffed, I never felt my care or treatment were compromised in any way and want to reassure anyone else having to go through a similar procedure that they will receive the very best of surgical treatment and nursing care.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: physic appointment
body:
the session of physio was excellent with complete understanding of my problem. the treatment recommended is working very well.
 Thanks to the staff

title: A practice to have confidence in.
body: Having recently, in the last three months, joined Harris memorial surgery May I say how happy I have been with the care received. We are all very quick to criticise but praise should never be neglected. The doctors, nursing staff and receptionists have all contributed to what I think is a very professional organisation, thank you so much for all you have done for me.

title: Cancellation of appointments
body:
Surely it would benefit Maylands and patients if a streamlined, even automated appointment cancellation service were introduced.
I have been holding by telephone a long time now - just to free up an appointment that may help another

title: Disappointing
body:
Is impossible to book an appointment of any kind through the patient access app as they‚Äôre fully booked for the next 3 weeks. Busy period i get it but if you need something and don‚Äôt want to sound rude with the receptionist asking for emergency call, is impossible to ear from a doctor. And even if you get a call most of the time is a nurse. 
Had a miss call, literally one minute later called back. Waited 35 minutes in line. On a call. Utterly frustrating. Waited 4 hours for a call back as they had no idea who tried to call me and about what. I had to call back for have the information, to know it was about some blood work I insisted to do ad i knew i had something off despite the nurse insisting i just need paracetamol and rest. I had something. Nothing too serious but i had to treat it. Talking to your doctor shouldn‚Äôt be suck a frustrating experience.

title: excellent staff
body: Can I let you know that last week and this week I have been cut off from my queue position when phoning, you then have to redial and start all over. You never get an appointment then. This makes it very stressful both for us and the staff. I have had stomach pains from taking a new medication but am self managing because of a two week wait for an appointment. I really don't want to take my neighbours advice to just turn up at surgery, this won't help anyone and I know things are very difficult but this problem must make your  lives very hard with people moaning and complaining which I haven,t done, I just had a review with the Asthma nurse who told me that I should just advice you of how things are at the moment. I have only lived in this area a year so met very few staff but all have been extremely kind and professional, its just very difficult to get through on the phone and very stressful! She has advised me on what to do in an extreme emergency(111) which I never knew so that is reassuring as my husband has heart and kidney failure and you just never know! thank you for all your care.

title: A struggling practice
body: Unfortunately seems to be a struggling practice.  Had a couple of wasted appointments due to inappropriate triage which ultimately delayed treatment and wasted everyone‚Äôs time.  Prescription service seems to have flaws and results in calling back practice to ask for the same thing again

title: Medical Staff  wearing mask below nose and below‚Ä¶
body:
1. On Fri 11-Feb-2022 I attended an outpatient appointment at Ashford Hospital Eye Clinic, Floor 2, Main Block.
2. The following are my observations - of which I have proof - from the Eye Clinic waiting room and reception area. Please note: my dealing with hospital staff in this review was, if surprised, one of civil empirical inquiry.
3. Numerous* Ashford Hospital Eye Clinic medical staff (uniformed nurses and non-uniformed eye specialists) wearing masks below the nose or below the mouth. In these instances, at times the masks would cover both nose and mouth, then at other times adjusted for periods below the nose, then at other times adjusted for periods below the mouth. An air of unconcerned convenience and common consent was evident among all medical staff - both mask wearing compliant and mask wearing non-compliant. *numerous in this content that even 1 is too many - my observed reference is of at least 4 medical staff and 3 outpatients. 
4. Numerous* outpatients in waiting room casually following Ashford Hospital Eye Clinic medical staff example of improper wearing of mask below the nose or below the mouth.  One outpatient after noticing medical staff example adjusted her mask below the nose, then after further time to below the mouth when not addressed on this issue by medical staff. Said outpatient then settled in wearing the mask round her/they neck like a necklace.
5. A casual nonchalant attitude of abandon by Ashford Hospital Eye Clinic medical staff when questioned regarding the above improper wearing of masks by numerous Ashford Hospital Eye Clinic medical staff and numerous Eye Clinic outpatients. No answer - merely an indifference avoidance of the issue and adjusting of the mask as it should be properly worn covering both nose and mouth.
6. Persons at ground reception 'not' wearing a mask and addressing me at one of two large open gaps from counted to ceiling - the smaller 20 inches along counter as measures by my elbow to outstretched fingers.

title: Terrible service
body:
Called twice today and on both occasions I waited for just over 15 mins which isn't the issue, the issue in question is the line was cut off at exactly the same time on both occasions
Absolutely disgraceful service

title: Brilliant unit
body: I got my gp to refer me to the hand unit as another unit elsewhere had not helped.The care and assessment were outstanding.A neck scan and nerve test were ordered and two wrong diagnoses done elsewhere were corrected and I was transferred to neurosurgery for treatment.

title: Too many patients
body: I have been with the service since it started but now want to move as just trying to get through on the phone takes over half an hour, if you can get in the queue.

author: Melrose12
title: Invaluable support for breastfeeding
body:
My little girl was born in March 2021 by emergency section. I lost a significant amount of blood and was quite poorly following the birth, so didn't get the immediate skin to skin I had hoped for.  
While in high dependency, the support I got from the IFSW and midwives was incredible. Knowing my wish was to breastfeed, but unable to get baby to successfully latch, they were gathering my colostrum for me while I couldn't do much to help.  
I had constant support, motivation, positive encouragement from the breastfeeding support worker throughout my stay in hospital. I ended up expressing in hospital and syringe feeding baby, but still working on getting the latch. Kareen made me feel empowered that I had all the knowledge I needed to be discharged and successfully feed my baby. Although I was still having issues getting baby to latch, I was offered so many tips and tricks and hints to try and encourage it.  
Had I not had that support, I am certain that I wouldn't still be breastfeeding almost a year later. The day after I got home, a community IFSW visited me and gave me the reassurance and encouragement I needed. I ended up using nipple shields as we were still struggling with the latch, however after about 3 months, baby refused the shields and wanted to latch herself! I contacted the IFSW team to ask if they could come back out to assess how we were doing and again someone came out the next day.  
It really is such an invaluable service to breastfeeding mothers. The more help, support and education around breastfeeding, the more likely we are to have more people doing it.

readBy.name: Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

title: Fast, efficient and friendly.
body:
I needed a consultation for a problem which had a sudden onset. I ‚Äòphoned the surgery and the call was answered immediately. I asked for a telephone consultation and this was arranged and within half an hour, I had spoken to the doctor and resolved the issue. The call was friendly, cheerful and professional; exactly what I would expect from a good surgery. 
I am very happy to commend this practice most highly

title: Cancellation of appointments
body:
Surely it would benefit Maylands and patients if a streamlined, even automated appointment cancellation service were introduced.
I have been holding by telephone a long time now - just to free up an appointment that may help another

title: Sorry terrible
body: Yesterday I was sent a text message too contact the surgery? Today I have tried online and by phone and can't speak to anyone ! The phone keeps cutting off and there are no longer taking any online questions  ! What  am I too do next

title: Part 2 of review
body: To continue my review I now wish to offer my thanks to the nursing staff and the receptionists. We all have bad days and bad experiences but fortunately this has not happened to me as far as the surgery is concerned. I want to say that the nurses and receptionists have performed their duties admirably, I have been treated exceptionally well, greeted with a smile every time and made to feel very welcome, I thank them all.

title: Privileged to say this is my GP!
body:
I feel so lucky that we have Cricklade Surgery looking after us! We have been with this surgery for just over a year now and the service we recieve is second to none!

The surgery hold a very good patient relationship and is a true family doctors! They remember you and ensures you are listened too!

Whenever we have been in hospital we always recieve telephone calls saying the drs would like to see us to do a check up. They always follow up to ensure we are safe and healthy.

They usually get you in the same day! The reception team are friendly and polite and always very helpful.

The Doctors listen to you and your concerns and are very thorough! They ensure you are dignified and respected at all times. They are polite and don't try to brush you off. They cover every angle to ensure brilliant care!

The nurses ensure to build a good working relationship with their patients to make them feel at ease.

This surgery is professional , maintains a high standard of care and support, clean, responsive and compassionate. Truly the best surgery by far.

Thank you for your great service and maintaining a good old professional family doctors approach!

title: Unable to see a Doctor
body: Unable to get an appointment either in person with Doctor or by phone consultation after trying for 3weeks Reception staff advised that My husband should go to A&E as it will be quicker ! Reception staff have No Empathy and are making medical judgement decisions with patients care!

title: Appointment system is a joke!
body: I contacted the practice now a couple times  in last 2 months. I don't understand why they cannot give you an appointment telephone time twice I have been waiting on phone call from GP but as I work sometimes I  just miss the call because of where I work. Then when you phone up to say you missed the call the receptionist are rude! They are not the only ones working and it be a lot easier to have a hour time slot instead trying to guess when you can do things as you are waiting around for a phone call.  I think the system should change and even when you go in the practice the way you not allowed anywhere by the desk as there are so many things in front then receptionist comes out to you and you have to explain all your business in front of other patients. Why isn't there glass screen put up around counter so you can actually have bit of privacy. Really thinking of changing GPS.

title: OUTSTANDING SERVICE
body: I cannot fault the surgery both online questions answered and ease of calling to get appointment. Clue is in the title - its a "family" ethos in every way.

author: Magswv6
title: Cannock Chase Hospital
body:
I was admitted to Cannock Chase Hospital for planned orthopaedic surgery. From the time l went in and during my stay l was treated with care and respect. The whole of the team were wonderful and nothing was too much trouble for them, they were there for me and catered for all of my needs. Rebecca, Michelle, Rash, Melanie and Shakira are but a few names that come to mind but the care from the whole team was first class and would like to say a massive thank you to you all. I am due back in Cannock for further surgery and will go in knowing that my treatment and care will be equally as good.  
The hospital was clean and the food good, which helps towards a speedy recovery. Once again, thank you all so very much.

author: DOofyhespoof
title: Care in hospital and community
body: I was in a lot of pain and very unwell due to critical limb ischemia. I was being looked after at home by the podiatrists in Beechall and then by Dr Reids (Vascular Consultant) team in the Royal Victoria Hospital and the Nursing staff in ward 6C. As well as being in a lot of pain and feeling poorly I was also very anxious about possible amputation. All of the doctors, nurses, podiatrists and ancillary team looked after all my needs both physically and emotionally.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: jamkw99
title: I shall never forget them
body: i had this procedure and i can not thank all persons involved enough they was all so careing made me feel comfortable and at ease explained clearly what was going to happen so so professional i shall never forget them also hospital very clean

author: tony19
title: Just like to say a big thank you
body: was in Victoria hospital 4 times in last couple of months as i kept pulling out my nephrostomy  the staff were great put me well at ease and explained every thing they were going to do, they had such a good laugh and kept so amused especially the we fluffy queen. Just like to say a big thank you to all who cared for me.

author: requirementrs78
title: Our daughter with meningitis
body:
We have been given world class care by a team of health care workers who ultimately saved our daughter‚Äôs life. 

From the first moment we arrived the nurses, doctors and consultants were compassionate and caring and would go out of their way to help and ask any questions. When things got tough they worked quickly, starting antibiotics and performing a lumbar puncture ensuring they were doing all that they could. I have worked in the nhs In many trusts in England and I have never seen such kindness and professionalism. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jennmuir
title: Wonderful staff
body:
Wonderful staff in Emergency department forth valley royal infirmary. We were recently in with a family member who was poorly but what could have been a highly stressful visit turned out to be the opposite . We were greeted by friendly and caring staff.  
Caring compassionate and friendly when clearly run off their feet - special mention to nurse Jilly who was wonderful, she took time to keep us up to date- such a caring, kind soul and just what the NHS needs . She kept us informed and relaxed during a difficult time and we can‚Äôt thankyou enough.  
Thankyou

author: Weefearty
title: Outstanding
body: The staff in the Urogynaecology clinic at the New Victoria are outstanding! They are not only efficient but also very welcoming and put me at ease. Special shout-out for Karen, Audrey and Lesley Ann.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: nikkis
title: Managing OCD
body:
Two years ago around the beginning of the first lockdown, I noticed my actions/behaviourism stated to manifest signs of OCD. I would constantly be checking doors, lights, taps etc. I didn't think much about it in the beginning because I told myself I was just being careful/responsible.  
It was only around 6 months ago that I realised things were getting worst. Although I didn't see it at the time even being able to sit and relax started to become difficult. Me being stubborn I still told myself that things will get better when we are out of lockdown and my responsibilities can start to change. I was wrong, it was only until I had somewhat of an emotional realisation that I needed help. Thus, with the help of family and friends, they told me to send put a self-application to Ealing IAPT. I was very surprised at how quick it was for me to be paired with a CBT therapist. My magnificent therapist was Sita. Sita is absolutely fantastic, by the end of the 10th week I was able to go about day to day life without worrying or feeling anxious. I was so surprised to see how quick CBT works especially since I had done all my sessions online over Microsoft Teams. Ultimately Sita has managed to help me regain control of my thoughts and behaviour in no time. On top of all that, speaking to someone who isn't a family member or friend helps so much with mental health. It's great just to be able to get things off your chest and not feel judged.  
I'm glad to say I'm a lot better and happier now.  
A big thank you to Ealing IAPT and especially the Sita for everything. It has been an amazing experience. Thank you!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Steel3795
title: Surprise hysteroscopy without pain relief
body:
A few months ago I had a hospital appointment as a follow-up from ultrasound investigation for fibroids. On this visit the ultrasound result was discussed and then I taken to another room and was asked to lay on the couch for an examination, a doctor from the team and either 1 or 2 nurses in attendance (I can't remember how many as I was so scared by the situation I was suddenly in). The doctor said "we need a quick look at the fibroid so we need to insert a camera/scope past your cervix to get a closer look".  
What happened next is still traumatising me. I was on the couch, and they started to try to get the camera/scope in through my cervix. The pain was worse than anything I have ever felt, I was in agony - it felt like they were trying to get an iron bar through.  
The first attempt failed so they tried again causing even more pain & distress. A third attempt followed and the doctor mentioned I had a very strong cervix which was fighting them and not letting the scope get through in a tone of voice that made it sound like it was my fault. The pain was worse with every attempt and my anxiety was through the roof.  
I begged them to stop as I couldn't take any more pain. They did stop after the third attempt and left me to get dressed... it was only after they had finished that the doctor asked me if I had never had children. I was left to get dressed and then left the hospital and staggered back to my partner waiting in the car.  
I was left traumatised, shaking and felt sick with the pain and I bled for a few days afterwards.  
I now have extreme anxiety and am getting flashbacks. I have to attend a different hospital in a few weeks time for a hysteroscopy, it was only on researching what was likely to be done at my new appointment that I realised that the procedure was almost identical to the one at the first hospital.  
I explained to my new consultant about what had happened to me and how fearful I am. They seemed very good over the phone and I was assured I can have gas & air, pain relief to be taken prior to the procedure and will use the smallest scope and at any time I can't cope they will stop if I ask. I hope the doctor will be as good as their word, on the phone they did not sound too impressed by my earlier experience. My fear & anxiety is off the scale. I have to have this done as they are checking in case it's anything more serious than a large fibroid because of my symptoms so I know it makes sense - I'm just terrified after what happened at the other place, I can't get it out of my mind. The closer to the appointment date is making the anxiety worse each day.  
Am I correct in thinking that the first hospital did indeed spring a hysteroscopy on me? I ask as I had no warning at all which meant no pain relief prior to the appointment, no anaesthetic gel during the procedure and I was left feeling totally violated. At no time was I asked to sign a consent form for this procedure and because no prior warning was given by the hospital I had no pain relief at all and no information was sent out to me. I was led to believe it was just a follow-up appointment to discuss the ultrasound result and possible treatment options.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Clare McKenna
title: Thank you to everyone
body: My children attended for penicillin challenges having both been labelled with a penicillin allergy. I was incredibly anxious to do this but the team were so lovely, putting myself and my children at ease from the moment we arrived. Dr Martin (as he told my children to call him) couldn‚Äôt have been nicer! Making jokes and praising them the whole time! He actually made it fun for them. I understand this service is still in its early (pilot) stages and much of the work is done by staff in their own time which makes it even more meaningful that they were so brilliant. Thank you to Dr Martin, Dr Christie and all the nurses at Children‚Äôs Immunology, RVH. Both my children are now de-labelled as having a penicillin allergy which will have a hugely positive impact on their future!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: charliemy58
title: Heart surgery at Forth Valley Royal Hospital
body:
I had been waiting for some nine months for cardiac surgery at my local NHS hospital without any result. It transpired that the NHS Forth Valley Royal Hospital in the adjoining Local Authority area which has remained open throughout this entire epidemic had capacity and agreed to perform the surgery.  
Entering the Forth Valley Royal Hospital was a bit like stepping out from the darkness into the light. The cold dead intransigence of my local hospital was replaced with a positive, warm and supportive embrace from the resident cardiology team lead by Consultant Omar. Exceptional people giving an exceptional service in exceptional circumstances. You know who you are.

author: Shuffle Bucket
title: Huge thank you to all
body: I had an MRI recently. The staff in the MRI Department were lovely, so patient with me having my condition and problems with getting in/out of my wheelchair and getting onto the MRI bench/bed. All of these staff members - Mary, Keeley & Alison were patient centred, helpful with me, as I plank a lot with my stiff legs. They were all happy, happy to help me and make me comfy & at ease! So huge thank you to you all üòÅ. 100% positive!

author: anonymous1313
title: Very positive A&E experience
body: I had to attend the A&E department in Stoke Mandeville Hospital earlier today due to a self harm injury. I really wasn't looking forward to it, as my previous experiences with that department have been very negative (ridiculous waiting times, rude staff, poor treatment of wounds, etc.) but I was very pleasantly surprised today. I was seen very quickly and the member of staff who did my sutures was really lovely: friendly, easy to talk to, non-judgemental, and very professional in how he dealt with my injury. Both myself and my registered carer felt that he was by far the best person I've been seen by in A&E and I'm feeling really grateful for how well everything was handled today.

title: No common sense
body:
I waited in a queue outside in the cold and rain for a blood pressure check.  This is unacceptable and demonstrates a lack of common sense. How can standing in the rain be conducive to good health, why have no alternative provisions been made for the winter months?  I gave up and returned home without a blood pressure test. 

Because patients are forced to queue in the car park this is the second time I have had to leave the practice without a blood pressure check - the first when a patient with mental health issues was being engaged in an argument with a receptionist instead of being taken somewhere private so that he's concerns could be treated with dignity and respect.

title: Horrific experience
body:
I'm 13.5 weeks pregnant and rushed to A&E yesterday at 4.30pm because i was bleeding. Had a massive haemmorage as i entered the building, soaking my clothes and panicking me. A&E was more like a busy visa office in a third world country, with every seat taken, people sitting on the floor, disengaged staff. I was told a nurse would see me shortly. It seemed totally chaotic there with names often being called of people who weren't even there. Three hours later the triage nurse called me in and said she would send me to emergency gynaecology. I went to the toilet and it was absolutely filthy. I waited another hour in my blood-soaked clothes just to have the triage nurse call me back in to say 'sorry but they won't scan you now, there's no more slots. They said to send you home and come back tomorrow.' This is "emergency" gynaecology. I guess everyone wanted to go home, although why on earth i wasn't sent there immediately is beyone me. I wasn't even seen by a consultant, just told to leave. I spoke to a GP via 111 because i needed some medical advice and she was shocked that St Marys had sent me home un-seen to. Thank goodness for Queen Charlotte hospital who met me today with calm professionalism, fitting urgency, compassion and getting me properly seen to - after a sleepless night not knowing if i'd lost my baby or not. Inhumane.
St Marys has been desperately rude to me on the phone once before, when i was trying to refer myself at the start of my pregnancy. However, i can be grateful for that because it meant i went to Queen Charlotte hospital (on the other end of the Imperial spectrum!) instead. In my experience, St Marys is a hell hole, not a civilised hospital and i would go a bit further to the Royal Free A&E if i ever have a future emergency. I'm appalled.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Excellent service
body: I have recently moved to this practice and have had excellent service, with a health review undertaken by a friendly, efficient and welcoming nurse. Contact with the surgery is prompt. Highly recommended.

title: Stopped prescription without notice
body: Ordered my prescription online received confirmation email. Went to collect from chemist. Only to discover nothing ready asked to returned in a couple of days. I returned still nothing. Went to the surgery only to find out im on a 6 monthly review & prescription on hold. I'd received no communication of this at all. So no anti-depressants for 7 days. Now Going through major relapse & withdrawal. After I confronted the surgery being asked to wait & return to collect later. Trust is zero!.

title: Lovely practice
body: My first visit to this practice,and have to say was very impressed, The receptionist and the doctor were lovely.can't thank them enough!!!üòâ

title: Very Thorough!!
body: I cannot recommend this practice more. A team of very caring doctors and nurses who go above and beyond and thoroughly check everything when presented with challenging, non specific symptoms. They have surpassed my expectations.

title: Excellent support from GP
body: I have received excellent care and service from this very good GP practice. The Drs have been very helpful and very supportive. They are obviously under a lot of pressure and coping with many challenges. From me a big thank you.

title: Good practice
body: Suffering with Covid I had to contact the surgery for an asthma puffer, I hadn‚Äôt had to use again until the Covid onset. The receptionist was extremely helpful and empathetic & caring and immediately arranged for one to be sent to a chemist that my daughter could collect it from. Having my asthma come back due to Covid was very alarming and the receptionists quick action put my mind to rest and helped me cope.

title: Excellent Practice
body: All staff v helpful and pleasant. Appointments available in good time. Considered and informative consultations.

title: Communication not as good
body: I had blood and stool tests done in December '21. Was told the receptionists could give me the results if I phoned. I did and was told results sent to Consultant and couldn't get any more information. Picked up a referral at the surgery and in it there was an abnormal blood result which no-one warned me about and no communication about it. I now find 14.02.22 that there was an abnormal stool test which was slightly abnormal. That means nothing but I should have been given this information to pass on the a GI Consultant as this may have changed his thinking. The abnormal blood result meant being suspended from the transplant list and no-one appears to be concerned about this. Then I am told 14.02.22 that I am being referred on the NHS yet have heard nothing about making an electronic booking. I don't feel that receptionists should be communicating abnormal blood results when they don't know what they are/mean or can't find them and can't then answer any questions. This is the responsibility of the GP. So please answer why you leave a patient to find out about an abnormal blood result in a referral letter and then don't communicate another abnormal result. Prior to Covid you were very quick to act about abnormal results but I have been very disappointed in the communication of these abnormal results. The implication for me has been massive and I could have missed out on a transplant as a result so not impressed.

title: Excellent service
body: Excellent online consultation. Followed up promptly and helpfully and the web portal worked very well. Prescription issued straight to the local pharmacy.

title: Informative and very kind
body: Excellent and explained the problem and said he would fix it during a day surgery with an appointment to follow

title: good practice
body: My surgery is good. great doctors that take time to listen to you. difficult trying to actually see a doctor  most appointments are over the phone at the moment since the pandemic

title: Top class practice
body:
What can I say about the surgery, I cannot fault the team at all for the upmost professionalism and dedication shown. They really do epitomise all that is good with general practice. It is sincerely and truly like one big family. Keep up the great work Tisbury Surgery. It is a pleasure to be one of your patients along with the rest of my family.
Warmest Regards,

title: Great practice
body: Quick and efficient appointment system. Received great care. Would recommend to others in the area!

title: Wonderful and professional care and treatment
body: After an emergency admittance for collapsed lung I received prompt, and professional care from doctors, nurses, nursing assistants, porters and scan staff throughout the hospital. Mary ward seemed to be blessed with very caring and helpful medical and ancillary staff. The atmosphere remained calm and peaceful whatever happened with patients

title: Always helpful
body:
Your Review:  The Docs was my surgery for 16 years. In all that time they have always been very helpful. I was always able to get an emergency consultation. The receptionists,were always cheerful and helpful. Last month when I moved, they automatically arranged my repeat prescription at a pharmacy near my new home.
I do not understand why there are any negative reviews on here.
I always tell people how good The Docs is. Keep up the good work.

title: One of the best
body:
Your Review:  I‚Äôve been a patient of this practice for twenty years.
All the doctors in this practice are excellent and demonstrate great empathy and understanding. The admin staff are warm caring and efficient.
I feel very well supported and would have no hesitation in recommending them to anyone looking to sign on with a new practice.
Thank you very much to a very special team!
L. Frost

title: Lovely supportive practice
body:
I‚Äôve been a patient of this practice for twenty years. The doctors and admin staff always go above and beyond expectations and show great care and empathy for their patients. I recently had to make an emergency call out and the GP came really quickly, got me admitted to hospital the same morning, and personally phoned me a few days later to check how I was. 
All the doctors in this practice are excellent and demonstrate great empathy and understanding. The admin staff are warm caring and efficient.
I feel very well supported and would have no hesitation in recommending them to anyone looking to sign on with a new practice.
Thank you very much to a very special team!
L. Frost

title: Dismal
body: Asked the receptionist for the name of the Practice manager, in order to complain. Was given a name that does not appear on the Practice's website.
